result.execSummary:
The defendant Cherry L Thomas Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Intercourse with Person under Age of 13, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(e).
  • 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Intercourse with Person under Age of 13, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay restitution in the amount of $1,952.39 to be paid to the Crime Victim Compensation Program. Restitution to be paid first before costs, fees and surcharges.

AS TO EACH COUNT:  Pay all costs, fees and surcharges. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Provide DNA sample (unless previously submitted) and pay DNA surcharge.
Court costs, fees, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.
Consecutive to: consecutive to COUNT 2 AMENDED, with credit for 165 days time served.

superMiscConds.notes:
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
No contact with Katherine R., KD dob 5/11/06, KG dob 10/18/08, or named witness KR.

Obtain/comply with sex offender treatment and evaluation.
Register/comply with the sex offender registry.

records.addlTxt: Packet of restitution information from CVC Program received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Defendant's work scheduled submitted by attorney DePeters received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
PSI received and filed. Parties notified. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant sworn in.

As to COUNT 1 AMENDED and COUNT 2 AMENDED-
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgments of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing and pay a DNA surcharge.

Court advised the defendant that upon a conviction of this offense he may be subject to Chapter 980 proceedings.
Court advised the defendant of the sex offender registry requirements.

Court vacated jury trial date of 5/26/15. 
Court ordered a presentence investigation WITHOUT a recommendation.  Order for presentence investigation signed and filed. 
Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into custody. 
Case adjourned to Branch 25. Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Cherry L Thomas in court with attorney Marcella De Peters.  Defendant Cherry L Thomas in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for final pretrial. Parties have reached a resolution. State filed an Amended Information. Defendant charged as follows:

COUNT 1- 1st Degree Sexual Assault - Sexual Intercourse with a Child Under Age 13, contrary to sec. 948.02(1)(e), 939.50(3)(b) Wis. Stats., a Class B Felony.

COUNT 2- 1st Degree Sexual Assault - Sexual Intercourse with a Child Under Age 13, contrary to sec. 948.02(1)(e), 939.50(3)(b) Wis. Stats., a Class B Felony.

Defense counsel acknowledged receipt of the amended information and waived reading.

Defendant Cherry L Thomas in court with attorney Marcella De Peters.  Defendant Cherry L Thomas in custody.  Cynthia M. Davis on behalf of Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for final pretrial. Defense counsel has not received an offer from the State and requests an adjourned final pretrial date. State does not object. Court granted defense request. Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 5/26/15. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed, Notice of expert testimony.
Received and Filed, Notice to admit forensic interviews.

Attorney Marcella De Peters in court, defendant Cherry L Thomas not in court, in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for scheduling conference. Counsel waives defendant's appearance for this hearing. Defense counsel now has all discovery from the State. Defense requests final pretrial and jury trial dates. Parties to file motions by 3/6/15. Any motions requiring testimony will be heard on the final pretrial date. Parties to file witness lists, jury instructions, and motions in limine by the final pretrial date. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Cherry L Thomas in court with attorney Marcella De Peters.  Defendant Cherry L Thomas in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 25.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: KD, DG
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Cherry L Thomas in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  
Defendant Cherry L Thomas in custody.  
William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. 
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
